PageText.pText: The function used to print output on a screen is the print statement where we can pass zero or more expressions separated by commas. The print function converts the expressions we pass into a string and writes the result to standard output.

>>>print(”Learning Python is fun and enjoy it.”) This will produce the following output on the screen. Learning Python is fun and enjoy it. In Python, we need not declare the type of the variable as in C or C++. The type of the variable depends on the value assigned to it. Hence we can simply assign a value to a variable.

>>>a=2 >>>print(“The value of a is”,a) This will produce the following output on the screen. The value of a is 2 The input([prompt]) function assumes the input is a valid Python expression and returns the evaluated result to us.
n = input(“Enter a number “) print(“The number is: “, n)
Enter a number: 5 The number is: 5
